thread.title: Ant and Dec finally meet the man who spent five hours getting their faces tattooed on his BUM
thread.title_full: Ant and Dec finally meet the man who spent five hours getting their faces tattooed on his BUM

author: Vicki Newman
title: Ant and Dec finally meet the man who spent five hours getting their faces tattooed on his BUM
text:
Ant and Dec finally meet the man who spent five hours getting their faces tattooed on his BUM Superfan Lee Crane was desperate to have his inking signed by the Geordie duo Share Ant and Dec finally met their tattooed superfan (Photo: antanddecofficial/Twitter) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Ant and Dec are everyone's favourite Geordie duo - but one superfan took his love for the presenters to a whole new level. 
Lee Crane had the award-winning TV hosts tattooed on his BUM, with Anthony McPartlin and Declan Donnelly getting a cheek each - and rather oddly, eating one string of spaghetti Lady and the Tramp-style. 
And now, he's finally met his heroes. 
The Saturday Night Takeaway hosts took to Instagram to share the news that they'd came face-to-face - or cheek-to-cheek - with their tattooed superfan. Read More Ant and Dec cheer Scarlett Moffatt up after breakup with Saturday Night Takeaway group meal The cheeky tattoo took five hours to complete 
In the hilarious snap, Dec looks a little shocked and Ant looks a bit worried as he points towards the etching of himself. 
He shared the picture, saying: "Oh god!! The day finally came where we met the tattoo guy!! A" 
Their fans couldn't handle it. 
One wrote: "Is that a compliment? Your faces are on his a**e!" 
And others simply expressed how much they were laughing. The Geordie duo finally met up with their superfan (Photo: ITV) 
Superfan Lee, 28, asked tattoo artist Steve Bell to put the Geordie duo on his posterior. 
The tattooist who inked the stars eating spaghetti on his customer's buttocks said the job took two and a half hours per cheek. 
Mr Bell, who runs the Clockwork Orange parlour in Norton, Teesside, broke his hand half way through the job so for some months Mr Crane had just Ant on one buttock. 
Mr Bell had seen a photo of Ant and Dec recreating the Lady and the Tramp spaghetti-eating scene and suggested it to his client. Read More Simon Cowell and Ant and Dec rush to help collapsed Britain's Got Talent contestant Ant and Dec recently received OBEs (Photo: PA) 
The tattooist said: "He is from the Newcastle area and he is a big Ant and Dec fan. 
"All in it took five hours, it was two-and-a-half hours per cheek. 
"Now it is his ambition to get his tattoo signed by them." 
Well, it looks like Lee may have got his wish after finally meeting Ant and Dec. Like us on Facebook
